top_comment.text: Was Stacey actually holding his breath?﻿
top_comment.author: Ayron Ford

comments.text:
+Bryn Johnson I hope you realize this comment has been answered for like 10 
days. It is possible to hold your breath for longer than 3 minutes just 
google it.
comments.author: Ayron Ford

comments.text:
NO WAY! He couldn't hold his breath for 3 min by himself! He used special 
scuba equipment...
comments.author: Bryn Johnson

comments.text:
+cowboybobob According to Guinness, the officially recorded World 
Record for holding ones breath is a Brazilian who held his breath for over 
20 minutes.  Of course, he prepared by breathing pure Oxygen first.

As long as you have oxygen in your system, you can hold your breath without 
dying.  Once the oxygen to the brain starts thinning, the body will 
"complain" and want to take a breath, but it is possible to hold you breath 
far beyond that point, just as a matter of willpower.

Whether it is possible to hold your breath long enough that your brain gets 
oxygen deprived I have no idea, but if the body is screaming to take a 
breath, there is probably a reason why not doing so for extended periods of 
time might be a bad idea. :D
comments.author: Eric Bess

comments.text:
I just dont think you get it Boss Sauce and there is no amount of telling 
you or showing you that is going to make you understand.
comments.author: cowboybobob

comments.text:

week was from yesterday's episode, as was Susan Weebers.  But so was this 
that came out today and a few others that haven't hit YouTube yet, but 
probably will in the next couple of days.

top_comment.author: Tevya Washburn

comments.text:
+Greatest Ever Okay... You could at least spell our church's name correctly 
if you're going to post that comment. I have nothing against your sharing 
of your opinion, I just have a bit of a pet peeve for spelling issues. Oh, 
dear... if I've spelled anything wrong in this comment, I'm going to really 
seem like a hypocrite.
Read on if you want a long, boring explanation that proves just what a bad 
YouTuber I am:






I am now going to go through your comment and point out all of the evidence 
proving you're a troll:





1. You kept repeating, over and over, the statement that you're not a 
troll. If you've seen typical cartoons, whenever somebody's lying (well, at 
least if they're a bad liar) they overly repeat things. For example: "Of 
course I didn't eat any ice cream, but if I did, it would've been very 
gross because I would've found a fly in it. Once again, I did not eat that 
ice cream! I didn't eat it.. how could you think that? I did not eat it!" 
Obviously, (though it would also depend on their tone of voice), you would 
know they were lying.


2. Not only did you insult Studio C ( which you did very thoroughly), you 
insulted several different people/things. To list them, Canadians, the 
Disney Channel, Jack and Jill, linear algebra, Mormons, and garbage. Okay, 
that last one wasn't too offensive. :)


3. You overused hate words. Once again, I'm going to list them. They were: 
unfunny, horrendous, overall bad, campy, tragic disgrace, utter filth, 
blind idea, emotionally dead, disgusting, internet trash, sickening, 
tasteless garbage, crazy, etc. I've got to say, even if you're trolling, 
this is a pretty creative vocabulary.


4. You acted condescending, undermining everybody else's opinion except 
yours. When you said "How dare you think otherwise", I became pretty 
convinced you were a troll. As said before, it's perfectly fine to share 
your opinion, but please take into account that nearly the entire world has 
a different opinion than you, so this is equal to saying "I hate the 
world." Pretty controversial - not everybody has the same, exact ideas as 
you do.


You know, I could go on forever, but I am just going to post this and hope 
for the best. I'm so sorry if this seems impolite in any way, but I just 
can't let anything go - even a YouTube comment. :/
comments.author: Leslie Delphinidae

comments.text: "no really, I'm not a troll"
comments.author: LeGrand Johnson

comments.text:
I suppose you could just say you don't care for it and leave it at that. 
Instead you decided to crap on others (Canadians for example).
comments.author: Sherrill Anderson

comments.text:
+LeGrand Johnson yeah I know it might seem that way, I tried to clarify but 
there really isn't a way to express strong opinions that are against the 
disgusting majority of the comments.  I'm sorry if it seemed like I was a 
troll, but I just really find this piece of internet trash sickening.  And 
I know this comment will seem like another troll but try to understand. 
This is not comedy, this is tasteless garbage.
comments.author: Greatest Ever

comments.text: lol +LeGrand Johnson​
comments.author: Sherrill Anderson

comments.text: tl;dr: "I am a troll, I am not a troll, I am a troll"
comments.author: LeGrand Johnson

comments.text:
I can't even believe how unfunny this actually was.  I swear I am not a 
troll looking for a dispute, but I'm offended by the horrendous acting and 
just the overall bad comedic instinct.  The only people who could find this 
funny are people who haven't seen any comedy movie ever and Canadians.  I 
have seen stuff on Disney channel that was less campy. compared to this, 
Jack and Jill is Airplane!.  I have seen linear algebra lectures that were 
funnier than this.  This is a tragic disgrace to comedy.  How dare you 
think otherwise.  Once again I am legitimately not a troll, I was just so 
disgusted at this utter filth that I felt I had to enlighten you people as 
to your blind idea of humor.  Please watch moves like Anchorman, Hangover, 
and 21 Jump Street.  There are funny things in life, don't give up because 
you are emotionally dead inside, you will gain a real sense of humor one 
day.
comments.author: Greatest Ever

comments.text: +Tevya Washburn  roflol          these guys are way too funny!
comments.author: Sheila B. DuBois

comments.text: Love love love Studio C :o)
comments.author: Sherrill Anderson

comments.text: My whole family loves Studio C
comments.author: LeGrand Johnson
